intro: Oxydectes fusca, commonly known as the blackleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Oxydectes fusca is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
